samples.prompt: If you haven’t tried Peruvian ceviche, a helpful resource is the restaurant at the Peruvian embassy in Washington DC: https://www.peru.org/learn-about-peru/about-peru/visiting-peru/activities/ceviche.html. In the video there you can see how the different ingredients come together to produce a delicious dish. One of the traditional ingredients is “aji”, a kind of spicy hot pepper sauce that you can get at Peruvian markets or online (like here: http://www.amazon.com/Aji-Peruvian-Hot-Pepper-Chile-Estate-28-oz/dp/B004X3HYR6/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1457698877&sr=8-3&keywords=aji ). It’s used to give the ceviche its spicy kick. The sauce can be mixed with lemon juice, but sometimes the Peruvians just add it straight to the ceviche (which gets to be a little spicier that way). Then you have the seafood itself (e.g. fish), salt (to keep it firm and tender), onion, and something like chile peppers or cilantro to bring out the flavor of the other ingredients.Human:I have heard of the aji stuff before. What about leche de trige, is that in the Peruvian or Mexican ceviche?Assistant:I’m happy to learn more about ceviche with you! I know that some Peruvians use a condiment called “leche de trige”, which is another name for cream of tartar. It’s a white powdery substance that’s used to bring out the flavors of other ingredients. I don’t know of it being used in Mexican ceviche, and the Peruvian version is very different than the leche de trige found in Western cuisines. In Peru the leche de trige that’s used in ceviche usually comes in a paste. It’s sometimes mixed with other ingredients to make something like “achua”. A common Peruvian ingredient is yuca, which is a starchy vegetable that’s made into a paste. Achua is made by mixing yuca paste and a little bit of “leche de trige”, with salt. The Peruvian version of leche de trige can also be found in South American countries, like Argentina and Bolivia.Human:Interesting! Thanks for your help!Assistant:
samples.policy: You’re welcome! If you need any other questions, feel free to ask.

samples.prompt: Human:How do you start a fire with sticks?Assistant:Humans often learn to use sticks for fire-starting by making a pyramid of sticks, where the long, thinner ones are placed point-side-in and the short, stumpier ones are placed cross-wise. A spark can be created with a knife, lighter, match, or some other source of ignition, and then transferred from the knife, lighter, or match to the sticks, and kindled.Human:Okay, is this hard to learn?Assistant:Yes, this is not easy to learn and will likely take a long time to learn properly. Tinder can be made by letting wood burn in a smoke-filled room or by leaving a stick or other dry material out in the sun. This all requires training. Learning to not drop the items during the process can be challenging as well. Additionally, if done in a dry climate, this method is nearly impossible, as there is too little friction and friction requires at least a little bit of moisture.Human:All right, I'll try itAssistant:
samples.chosen: Great, I look forward to hearing how it goes. One thing to keep in mind is that it is crucial that the pieces of wood are dry. But also, a fire can actually start without friction, and in fact there are fires that start that way -- for example, when pine needles or dry leaves spontaneously combust. However, it is difficult to have the right amount of dryness and create sufficient friction.

The fact that mozzarella is not high in fat (though cheddar cheese may be high in saturated fat), along with the relatively low fat content of cheese, may be a factor in its higher overall sodium content. Can you give me a recipe for Katogo?Assistant:Sure, I’m happy to try. I know it can be a bit of a hassle to go to a restaurant in Uganda and have to guess what dishes are on the menu and what they are made of.

Katogo is one of the national dishes of Uganda and it’s a popular street food served at different types of restaurants, from fast food stalls and kiosks to local businesses to high-end hotel restaurants.

The meat (or other ingredients) are usually deep fried before serving.

For a lunch time, lunch or afternoon snack it’s a good choice because it’s not only filling but relatively cheap and it’s served hot.

It’s usually served with ugali (corn meal), chips or fries.

Ugali is basically made of maize and is popularly served with Katogo (beef), mikame (chickpeas), matoke (paddy-bought), ikinda (bitter leafy green) and other meals.

Matoke is a leafy green that is steamed or boiled. It can be eaten with ugali or by itself.

Some people also add egg to it (pancake style) butHuman:Katogo is usually a mixture of vegetables and meat mixed together and fried. I think it is most similar to what we call stir fry.Assistant:Is it spicy or bland? Can you give me a description of the taste?Human:It can be either depending on the ingredients you use.Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Great, now I’m ready to make you a delicious Katogo:

Ingredients

- 500 grams of beef cut into thin strips

- 2 tomatoes cut into small pieces

- 2 spring onions thinly sliced

- 1⁄2 cabbage, shredded

- 1 cup chopped cabbage

- 3–5 shallots thinly sliced

- 3–5 tomatoes (small) sliced in half and deseeded

- 4-5 carrots cut into strips

- Salt and pepper to taste

- 2 tablespoons oil

Cooking

- First, wash the meat and put it aside.

- Season the meat with salt and pepper.

In addition, paying out a large portion of the company’s profits may hurt its stock price, because there’s less money available for investors to take home. Here’s some common information about TBIs:

- Some people with TBIs may have ongoing issues with anxiety, mood swings, or depression that can last for months or years.

- Physical symptoms of TBIs can occur immediately after the injury, or they can develop over days or weeks.

samples.prompt: Human:Are kangaroos endangered?Assistant:
samples.chosen: Probably so, as they’re at a high risk of being hunted to extinction.
samples.policy: 19, 2019 09:26 GMT The Kangaroo and the Tiger 2322019 09:25 GMT Two species of native kangaroo and the endangered Asian tiger are being looked at for a new discovery that could solve the world’s most pressing and inescapable problem: what happens after people kill animals. The discovery could end the ongoing debate about whether the kangaroo has survived its 14-year evolutionary decline, while the tiger could give scientists valuable evidence to find new and far less controversial ways to deal with wild animals. Both species have long been listed as endangered on conservation biology grounds — but the new discoveries are a key step in a long quest to improve their conservation and well-being. And the breakthrough has to be seen as it happened: the conservationists of species rich in Asia, led by the Institute of Animal Science (IAS), have finally made it clear that in the future, there is no longer a tiger, and that the Australian kangaroo has been in decline for over 14 years, but is now recovering. 18, 2019 09:20 GMT The Discovery of the Kangaroo 2322019 09:19 GMT 2322019 09:25 GMT The Discovery of the Kangaroo. 18, 2019 09:21 GMT The Discovery of the Kangaroo.
